chunks.text: ................................16 | User Guide Execute Work - HTM Tech Plus THIS PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK ## EXECUTE WORK ## Summary This lesson introduces how valid and invalid Work Orders are reviewed, how you can take ownership of a Work Order, and how to defer or update its status to In Progress or Canceled. For more information about this process, please go to Appendix A -Execute Work Business Process to view the flowchart and step narrative. ## User Roles and Responsibilities The audience for this training includes the following user roles: | Role | Responsibility | |---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | EPS Admin | Reviews, assigns and approves Work Orders; develops Job Plans; creates PMs (preventive maintenance); prioritizes and sche

---------------------------------------------------------------| | EPS Admin | Reviews, assigns and approves Work Orders; develops Job Plans; creates PMs (preventive maintenance); prioritizes and schedules PM Work Orders | | EPS Work Lead | Reviews, assigns, prioritizes and completes WorkOrders | | FM Admin | Receives, classifies and disposes building service equipment (BSE) Assets; reviews and approves Work Orders; creates PMs (preventive maintenance); approves PM work deferrals; creates Job Plans | | FM Supervisor | Reviews and evaluates Service Requests; plans and approves work; monitors and assigns Work Orders to FM Techs in their Responsible Shops. | | FMTech | Performs work and completes Work Orders; identifies need to defer work; updates PM work status | | FM Work Order Clerk | Reviews and evaluates Service Requests; receives, classifies and disposes building service equipment (BSE) Assets; reviews and evaluates Service Requests; plans and approves work and assigns Work Orders t

ews and evaluates Service Requests; receives, classifies and disposes building service equipment (BSE) Assets; reviews and evaluates Service Requests; plans and approves work and assigns Work Orders to FM shops; creates PMs (preventive maintenance) | | HTMAdmin | Classifies Assets; reviews and approves Work Orders; creates PMs (preventive maintenance); approves PMwork deferrals; creates Job Plans; determines need for decontamination/sanitization of turned in Assets | | HTMTech | Performs work and completes Work Orders, identifies need to defer work; updates PMwork status; completes decontaminates/sanitizes Work Orders on turned in Assets | | HTMTech Plus | Performs work, identifies need to defer work, and updates PM work status, work reassignment | | VA Work Order Clerk | Reviews and evaluates Service Requests; plans and approves work and assigns Work Orders to HTMshops | ## Learning Objectives - · Describe the process for executing work - · Identify the Work Order review process - · A

ates Service Requests; plans and approves work and assigns Work Orders to HTMshops | ## Learning Objectives - · Describe the process for executing work - · Identify the Work Order review process - · Assign or take ownership of a Work Order - · Demonstrate how to defer or update a Work Order status (to In Progress or Canceled) - · Explain how to create an approved follow-up Work Order ## Agenda | Topic | Estimated Time | |------------------------------------------|------------------| | Review a Work Order | 05 min | | Assign or Take Ownership of a Work Order | 05 min | | Update Work Order Status | 20 min | | Create an Approved Follow-up Work Order | 05 min | | TOTAL: | 35 min | ## ACRONYMS USED IN THIS LESSON | Acronym | Description | |-----------|-----------------------------------------------------------| | CM | Corrective Maintenance | | CNL | Could Not Locate | | EMS | Environmental Management Services | | HTM | Healthcare Technology Management (Biomedical Engineering) | | IU | In U

----------------| | CM | Corrective Maintenance | | CNL | Could Not Locate | | EMS | Environmental Management Services | | HTM | Healthcare Technology Management (Biomedical Engineering) | | IU | In Use | | LO | Loaned Out | | OOS | Out of Service | | PM | Preventive Maintenance | ## REVIEW A WORK ORDER The Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor, or Tech roles will review the Work Order. - · If the Work Order is valid, the Admin, WO Clerk, Supervisor or Tech assigns or takes ownership of the Work Order, which is what we will cover here. - · If the Work Order is not valid, the Admin or Work Order Clerk reviews the invalid Work Order and determines whether it can be edited or must be canceled. - o If the Work Order must be canceled, the Admin or Work Order Clerk changes the Work Order status to 'Canceled.' Refer to the Update Work Order Status section which we will cover later in this lesson. - o If the Work Order can be edited, the Work Order goes back through the Plan and Approve Work Pro

' Refer to the Update Work Order Status section which we will cover later in this lesson. - o If the Work Order can be edited, the Work Order goes back through the Plan and Approve Work Process . ## ASSIGN OR TAKE OWNERSHIP OF A WORK ORDER If the Work Order is valid, the Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor or Tech assigns or takes ownership of the Work Order. Work Orders are scheduled and assigned to a Responsible Tech by the HTM Admin, EMS Admin, and Work Order Clerk. Before assigning ownership to a Work Order and changing the status to In Progress , verify if the Work Order requires any of the following field entries: - · Work Type - · Vendor Support - · Job Plan - · Priority - · Planned Labor/Craft Use the following steps to assign or take ownership of a Work Order: Step 1. From the Start Center , select Work Order Tracking in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Work Order Tracking application opens with the List tab selected.

From the Start Center , select Work Order Tracking in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Work Order Tracking application opens with the List tab selected. Figure 1. Work Order -List Tab Step 2. On the List tab, enter information into one or more filter fields and press Enter on your keyboard. Select the appropriate Work Order. The Work Order opens on the Work Order tab. Figure 2. Work Order List Tab -Filter Fields Step 3. To assign the Work Order to another person, select the toolbar. The Select Owner Dialog Box displays. Select Owner icon on the Figure 3. Assigning/Taking Ownership IMPORTANT! HTM Techs cannot assign another person. They can only take ownership (See next step) Figure 4. Select Owner Dialog Box Step 4. To take ownership of the Work Order, select the Take Ownership and your ID populates in the Responsible Tech field. icon on the toolbar Figure 5. Responsible Tech Updated ## UPDATE WORK ORDER STATUS Once the Admin, Work Order

ork Order, select the Take Ownership and your ID populates in the Responsible Tech field. icon on the toolbar Figure 5. Responsible Tech Updated ## UPDATE WORK ORDER STATUS Once the Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor or Tech determines that the Work Order is valid and assigns it or takes ownership, they then need to determine whether the work needs to be in progress, deferred, or canceled. Step 1. From the Start Center , select Work Order Tracking in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Work Order Tracking application opens with the List tab selected. Figure 6. Work Order -List Tab Step 2. On the List tab, enter information into one or more filter fields and press Enter on your keyboard. Select the appropriate Work Order. The Work Order opens on the Work Order tab. Figure 7. Work Order List Tab -Filter Fields - Step 3. Select the Change Status displays. icon on the toolbar. The Change Status dialog box Figure 8. Toolbar -Change Status Icon Step 4.

Figure 7. Work Order List Tab -Filter Fields - Step 3. Select the Change Status displays. icon on the toolbar. The Change Status dialog box Figure 8. Toolbar -Change Status Icon Step 4. In the New Status field, select the appropriate status from the drop-down menu. Figure 9.Change Status Dialog Box -Select New Status Step 5. Select OK . NOTE: For an explanation of the various Work Order Status codes available from the New Status drop-down menu, refer to Appendix B -Work Order Status Codes for details. We will cover below the three most common status codes. - 1. When should you update Work Order Status to In Progress ? INPRG In Progress or Initiated ( ) indicates work has started and is In progress or Initiated . In Progress is similar to Approved in that, you cannot delete tasks, labor or materials. You cannot cancel tasks either. However, you can change the status of the Work Order back to Waiting on Approval from In Progress if additional changes need to be made.

You cannot cancel tasks either. However, you can change the status of the Work Order back to Waiting on Approval from In Progress if additional changes need to be made. Note that the only way to go from In Progress to Approved is by changing the status to Waiting Approval and then to Approved. - 2. When should you Defer a Work Order (accomplished by updating the PM Results field to DEFER )? DEFER Deferred ( ) indicates that the PM Work Order cannot be completed. This status requires selection of one of the following options in the Deferred Reason field: - · CNL -Could Not Locate - · IU -In Use - · LO -Loaned Out - · OOS -Out of Service - · OTHER - Other NOTE: If the reason the Work Order was deferred is NOT listed in the options available (listed above), select OTHER in the Deferred Reason field and then type the appropriate reason in the Other Deferral Reason field, which is required before the Work Order can be saved.

tions available (listed above), select OTHER in the Deferred Reason field and then type the appropriate reason in the Other Deferral Reason field, which is required before the Work Order can be saved. IMPORTANT! This code is used to track all PM Work Orders that are deferred for reasons other than the options available. - 3. When should you update Work Order Status to Canceled ? CAN (Canceled) indicates the work will not be performed and is canceled. If the Work Order has already been initiated and has actuals reported against it, you cannot change the status to CAN. If the Work Order has already been initiated but does not have any actuals reported against it, you can change the status to WAPPR (Waiting on Approval) then change to CAN. NOTE: No changes can be made to the Work Order once it has been canceled. The following toolbar icons allow for quick changes to a Work Order status: - · Changes the status to In Progress - · Changes the status to Approved - · Changes the status to Comp

The following toolbar icons allow for quick changes to a Work Order status: - · Changes the status to In Progress - · Changes the status to Approved - · Changes the status to Completed ## CREATE AN APPROVED FOLLOW-UP WORK ORDER The most common use cases for creating a follow-up Work Order are: - 1. When you notice during a Preventive Maintenance (PM) that you have something that requires Corrective Maintenace (CM), you will create your CM as a follow-up to your PM. - 2. When you have performed a repair to bring a piece of equipment back into service, however it turned out that it still needs further repairs to be in optimal condition. To create a follow-up Work Order, follow these steps: - Step 1. From the Start Center , select Work Order Tracking in the Favorite Applications portlet. The Work Order Tracking application opens with the List tab selected. Figure 10. Work Order -List Tab Step 2. On the List tab, enter information into one or more filter fields and pre

The Work Order Tracking application opens with the List tab selected. Figure 10. Work Order -List Tab Step 2. On the List tab, enter information into one or more filter fields and press Enter on your keyboard. Select the appropriate Work Order. The Work Order opens on the Work Order tab. Figure 11. Work Order List Tab -Filter Fields ## Step 3. From the Select Action menu, select Create and then select Work Order . Figure 12. Select Action Menu -Create Work Order Selection NOTE: The Responsible Tech field is automatically populated with the login id of the person who created the follow-up. Step 4. Select the Related Records tab and select the chevron work order. to navigate to the follow-up Figure 13. Related Records Tab Step 5. Assign or Take Ownership of a Work Order. (See earlier Lesson Topic) Step 6. To approve the Work Order, select the Approve Work Order icon on the toolbar. You may also change to a different status as appropriate.

(See earlier Lesson Topic) Step 6. To approve the Work Order, select the Approve Work Order icon on the toolbar. You may also change to a different status as appropriate. See Appendix B and earlier topic within this lesson. Step 7. Select OK . IMPORTANT! You do not need to create a Follow-up Work Order if the Work Type of the Work Order is PM and the PM Result is CA -Corrective Action Required . Maximo automatically generates a follow-up Work Order for this work so no action is required. We will learn more about scheduling PM Work Orders in a future lesson. ## REVIEW ## Knowledge Check ## 'A Minute to Win It' Use your Guide, if needed, to answer the following questions within the minute allowed. - 1. True or False. Maximo automatically generates a follow-up work order if the PM Result is CA -Corrective Action Required . - a. True - b. False - 2. You may create a follow-up work order within the work order tracking via the following: - a.

rates a follow-up work order if the PM Result is CA -Corrective Action Required . - a. True - b. False - 2. You may create a follow-up work order within the work order tracking via the following: - a. Save Query button - b. Select Action Menu - c. Select Value icon - d. None of the above - 3. True or False. You can change a work order's status to CAN (Canceled) after actuals have been reported against it. - a. True - c. False ## APPENDIX A EXECUTE WORK BUSINESS PROCESS - Figure 14. Execute Work Business Process Map | Step Number | Description | |---------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 2.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 2.3.1 | The Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor, or Tech reviews the Work Order. • If the Work Order is valid, continue to step 2.3.3. • If the Work Order is not valid, continue to step 2.3.2. | | 2.3.2 | The Admin or Work Order Clerk reviews the invalid Work Order and determines whether it can be edited or must be canceled. • If the Work Order must be canceled, the Admin or Work Order Clerk changes the Work Order status to 'Canceled'. Continue to step 2.3.7. • If the Work Order can be edited, the Work Order goes back through the Plan and Approve Work Process. | | 2.3.3 | If the Work Order is valid, the Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor or Tech assigns/takes ownership of the Work Order. • If the work needs to be deferred, continue to step 2.

| | 2.3.3 | If the Work Order is valid, the Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor or Tech assigns/takes ownership of the Work Order. • If the work needs to be deferred, continue to step 2.3.5. • If the work does not need to be deferred, continue to step 2.3.4. | | 2.3.4 | The Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor, or Tech changes the Work Order status to In Progress. Additionally, the Tech or Work Lead determines whether the work is covered by warranty or a service contract. • If the work is covered by a warranty or service contract, continue to step 2.3.8. • If the work is not covered by a warranty or service contract, continue to step 2.3.10. | | 2.3.5 | The Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor, or Tech changes the Work Order value of PM Results field to DEFER. Continue to process WM-2.6 Defer Work. | | 2.3.6 | Maximo sends the work requestor and/or Asset owner (as indicated on the Service Request) a notice of a change in status for the Work Order.

Continue to process WM-2.6 Defer Work. | | 2.3.6 | Maximo sends the work requestor and/or Asset owner (as indicated on the Service Request) a notice of a change in status for the Work Order. The process ends. | | 2.3.7 | The Admin or Work Order Clerk changes the Work Order status to Canceled. Maximo will send the work requestor and/or Asset owner (as indicated on the Service Request) a notice of a change in status of the Work Order. The process ends. | Table 1. Execute Work Business Process | Step Number | Description | |---------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 2.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 2.3.8 | If the Asset is covered by warranty or a service contract, the Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor, or Tech submits the Asset or notice to the vendor to provide services on the Asset. | | 2.3.9 | The vendor provides the service. If the service is completed, the process continues to process WM-2.4 Record and Close Out Work . If the Work is not OK, continue to step 2.3.11. | | 2.3.10 | If the Asset is not covered by warranty or a service contract, the Admin, WOClerk, Supervisor or Tech performs the work. Please note that the Work Lead ensures the work is performed. EMS Emergency work may start with step 2.3.9 (meaning no Service Request is required). If the work is finished, continue to process WM-2.4 Record and Close Out Work . If the work is not finished, continue to process WM-2.

3.9 (meaning no Service Request is required). If the work is finished, continue to process WM-2.4 Record and Close Out Work . If the work is not finished, continue to process WM-2.6 Defer Work. | | 2.3.11 | The Admin, Work Order Clerk, Supervisor, or Tech creates an approved follow-up Work Order. Continue to WM- 2.2 Plan and Approve Work. | ## APPENDIX B WORK ORDER STATUS CODES - Work Order status may be changed by selecting a Change Status icon on the toolbar. Changing the status also saves the Work Order. The following status codes can be used on a Work Order: - · APPR (Approved) indicates the work plan has been approved and the work can begin. You can report actuals against approved Work Orders. Once the status is changed to Approved, the user can no longer delete tasks, labor or materials using the Delete Row (trash can) icon. The user can change the status of individual tasks to Canceled which is similar to deleting a task.

oved, the user can no longer delete tasks, labor or materials using the Delete Row (trash can) icon. The user can change the status of individual tasks to Canceled which is similar to deleting a task. The Work Order status can be changed back to Waiting Approval from Approved if other information needs to be modified. However, information cannot be deleted if the Work Order was previously in an Approved status. - · CAN (Canceled) indicates the work will not be performed and is canceled . If the Work Order has already been initiated and has actuals reported against it, you cannot change the status to CAN. If the Work Order has already been initiated but does not have any actuals reported against it you can change the status to WAPPR then change to CAN. - · CLOSE (Closed) finalizes and closes the Work Order. No changes can be made to the Work Order. - · COMP (Completed) status indicates all the physical work has been completed . You cannot delete any information on the Work Order when th

No changes can be made to the Work Order. - · COMP (Completed) status indicates all the physical work has been completed . You cannot delete any information on the Work Order when the status is complete, however, information (Log, Labor, Material, etc.) can be added to the Work Order. Once a Work Order has been completed, the only status that it can be changed to is closed. - · INPRG (In Progress or Initiated) indicates work has started and is In progress or Initiated . In Progress is similar to Approved in that, you cannot delete tasks, labor or materials. You cannot cancel tasks either, but you can change the status of the Work Order back to Waiting on Approval from In Progress if additional changes need to be made. Note that the only way to go from In Progress to Approved is by changing the status to Waiting Approval and then to Approved. - · WAPPR (Waiting Approval) is the default status for creating new Work Orders.

hat the only way to go from In Progress to Approved is by changing the status to Waiting Approval and then to Approved. - · WAPPR (Waiting Approval) is the default status for creating new Work Orders. In this status, a user can delete tasks, labor and materials with ease by using the Delete Row (trash can) icon and saving the record. However, a user cannot update the labor or materials information on the Actuals tab while the status is in Waiting on Approval. This is the only status in which a Job Plan can be applied or removed. - · WMATL (Waiting on Material) indicates materials must arrive before the work can be performed. - · WPART (Waiting for Parts) indicates waiting for part before work can be performed or completed. - · WIRSC (Waiting for Internal Resources) indicates waiting for internal VA resources before work can be performed or completed. - · WCONT (Waiting for Contractor) indicates waiting for a contractor before work can be performed or completed.

indicates waiting for internal VA resources before work can be performed or completed. - · WCONT (Waiting for Contractor) indicates waiting for a contractor before work can be performed or completed. - · WOIT (Waiting for OIT) indicates waiting for OIT before work can be performed or completed. - · WVEND (Waiting for Vendor) indicates waiting for a vendor before work can be performed or completed. - · WPCOND (Waiting on Plant Condition) indicates you don't currently have access to the Asset or location, so the work cannot be performed until you do. NOTE: The waiting statuses should not be counted against Work Order aging metrics.
